back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a specific thing or person previously mentioned or known.

back_cards.definition_en: A type or kind of something.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a way of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: Running is a great form of exercise.
Give me a chance to explain myself.
There’s a chance it might rain later.

back_cards.definition_en: Luck or fortune in an event.
back_cards.example_en: I found this by chance at the store.
I’ll take a chance on this new restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to politely make a request.
back_cards.example_en: Any chance you could help me move?

back_cards.definition_en: A medicine used to treat illness.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor prescribed a drug for my cold.
The police found drugs in the car.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance that affects the body.
back_cards.example_en: This drug helps with pain relief.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe addiction or overuse.
back_cards.example_en: He’s struggling with drug addiction.

back_cards.definition_en: A chemical used for a specific effect.
back_cards.example_en: Some drugs can cause side effects.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the economy or finances.
back_cards.example_en: The country faced an economic crisis.
This car is very economic on gas.
Economic growth is good for jobs.
We need an economic plan for the project.
This region is in economic decline.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of circumstances or conditions.
back_cards.example_en: We’re in a tough situation right now.
The situation at work is stressful.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a state of affairs.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s assess the situation before acting.
I wouldn’t want to be in her situation.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a problem or issue.
back_cards.example_en: How do we handle this situation?
I’ll choose the blue shirt today.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a decision between options.
back_cards.example_en: You need to choose a college major.

back_cards.definition_en: To prefer or opt for something.
back_cards.example_en: She chose to stay home tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: To decide on a course of action.
back_cards.example_en: We chose to walk instead of drive.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to indicate a deliberate choice.
back_cards.example_en: Why did you choose this restaurant?

back_cards.definition_en: Repeated activity to improve a skill.
back_cards.example_en: I need to practice my piano tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional activity, like law or medicine.
back_cards.example_en: She has a medical practice downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of doing something regularly.
back_cards.example_en: It’s good practice to save money.

back_cards.definition_en: To rehearse or train for something.
back_cards.example_en: The team is practicing for the game.
Recycling is a common practice here.
The storm was the cause of the delay.
His speech caused a lot of excitement.

back_cards.definition_en: A goal or principle worth supporting.
back_cards.example_en: She’s fighting for a good cause.
Lack of sleep can cause tiredness.
We donated to the cause for clean water.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling or showing joy or contentment.
back_cards.example_en: I’m so happy to see you!
She’s happy with her new job.
That was a happy surprise for everyone.
Happy birthday to you!
It was a happy coincidence we met.

back_cards.definition_en: The study of the natural world.
back_cards.example_en: She loves learning about science in school.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of knowledge or research.
back_cards.example_en: Biology is her favorite branch of science.
Science helps us understand the universe.

back_cards.definition_en: A method based on observation and testing.
back_cards.example_en: This discovery was made through science.
Science has improved our lives greatly.

back_cards.definition_en: To become a member of a group.
back_cards.example_en: I decided to join the book club.
Join these two wires carefully.
Will you join us for dinner tonight?
They joined forces to solve the problem.

back_cards.definition_en: To meet at a specific point.
back_cards.example_en: The rivers join at the valley.
She teaches math at the high school.

back_cards.definition_en: To show or explain how to do something.
back_cards.example_en: Can you teach me how to cook this?
He taught his kids to ride bikes.

back_cards.definition_en: To impart a skill or lesson.
back_cards.example_en: This experience taught me patience.
I want to teach in a rural school.
They’re working to develop a new app.

back_cards.definition_en: To create or build over time.
back_cards.example_en: She developed a strong interest in art.
His skills have developed a lot.

back_cards.definition_en: To reveal or come into existence.
back_cards.example_en: A problem developed during the project.
I need to develop these old photos.

back_cards.definition_en: To divide or give a portion to others.
back_cards.example_en: Can you share your snacks with me?
She shared her ideas with the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To use or enjoy something together.
back_cards.example_en: We share an apartment downtown.
He shared the news on social media.
We share a love for hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to the person being addressed.
back_cards.example_en: You should treat yourself to a break.
Make sure you do it yourself.
Don’t hurt yourself while hiking.
You can see yourself in the mirror.
Believe in yourself, you can do it!
Can you carry this box for me?
This bus carries passengers to town.
I always carry a pen in my bag.

back_cards.definition_en: To bear a burden or responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: She carries a lot of stress at work.
Mosquitoes can carry diseases.
Her explanation was very clear.
The road is clear for driving now.
I need to clear the dishes from the table.
Let’s clear up this misunderstanding.
The sky is clear tonight.
My brother is coming over for dinner.
He’s like a brother to me.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a group or community.
back_cards.example_en: The brothers in the club are tight-knit.
Hey, brother, how’s it going?

back_cards.definition_en: A fellow member of an organization.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a brother in the fraternity.

back_cards.definition_en: A subject or situation of concern.
back_cards.example_en: This is a serious matter we need to discuss.
The scientist studied organic matter.
Your opinion really matters to me.
What’s the matter with your car?

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to content or information.
back_cards.example_en: The book covers complex matters.
The plant is dead from lack of water.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a complete lack of activity.
back_cards.example_en: The street was dead at midnight.
I hit the target dead center.
That project is dead and gone now.
My phone battery is completely dead.
I saw a cool image in the magazine.
I have a clear image of the plan.
Her public image is very positive.

back_cards.definition_en: A reflection, as in a mirror.
back_cards.example_en: The lake showed a perfect image of the trees.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure of speech or metaphor.
back_cards.example_en: The poet used vivid images in her work.

back_cards.definition_en: A celestial body in the sky.
back_cards.example_en: The stars were bright last night.

back_cards.definition_en: A shape with points, like an asterisk.
back_cards.example_en: Draw a star on your paper.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to rate quality, as in reviews.
back_cards.example_en: This hotel got five stars.
He’s the star of the school play.

back_cards.definition_en: The price or amount paid for something.
back_cards.example_en: The cost of this shirt is twenty dollars.
This project will cost a lot of time.
His decision cost him his job.
The repair costs were surprisingly low.

back_cards.definition_en: To estimate or determine a price.
back_cards.example_en: We need to cost out this renovation.

back_cards.definition_en: In a straightforward or easy way.
back_cards.example_en: Just simply follow the instructions.
It’s simply a matter of time.
I’m simply asking for your opinion.

back_cards.definition_en: In a plain or unadorned way.
back_cards.example_en: The room was simply decorated.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to clarify or stress a point.
back_cards.example_en: I simply don’t understand the problem.
I posted a photo on social media.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of writing, like a blog or article.
back_cards.example_en: Her latest post got a lot of likes.

back_cards.definition_en: A pole or stake in the ground.
back_cards.example_en: The sign is on a wooden post.
I need to post this letter today.
He was assigned to a military post.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people living together.
back_cards.example_en: Our society values education highly.

back_cards.definition_en: The community or culture of a place.
back_cards.example_en: She studies the history of society.

back_cards.definition_en: An organized group with a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: I joined the local gardening society.
Society is changing rapidly these days.
He avoids society and prefers solitude.
I took a picture of the sunset.
She hung a picture on the wall.
I can’t get a clear picture of the plan.
Let’s go see a picture this weekend.
The economy paints a grim picture.

back_cards.definition_en: A part or portion of something.
back_cards.example_en: I ate a piece of cake.
This is a fine piece of art.
She played a piece on the piano.

back_cards.definition_en: A small part of a larger whole.
back_cards.example_en: A piece of the puzzle is missing.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a unit or amount.
back_cards.example_en: Can you give me a piece of paper?

back_cards.definition_en: Material used for writing or printing.
back_cards.example_en: I need some paper for my notes.
She wrote a paper for her history class.
I read the news in the paper today.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to official documents.
back_cards.example_en: Please sign these papers for me.

back_cards.definition_en: A thin sheet for wrapping or crafting.
back_cards.example_en: We used tissue paper for the gift.

back_cards.definition_en: Power or ability to do work.
back_cards.example_en: This drink gives me a lot of energy.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of power, like electricity.
back_cards.example_en: We’re switching to solar energy.
She brings so much energy to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in science to describe force.
back_cards.example_en: Energy is neither created nor destroyed.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of liveliness or spirit.
back_cards.example_en: The room had a positive energy today.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to an individual’s private life.
back_cards.example_en: I don’t share my personal details.
She gave me her personal opinion.
This is my personal laptop.
I prefer personal meetings over calls.
That’s a personal matter, not public.

back_cards.definition_en: A structure with walls and a roof.
back_cards.example_en: That building is a new office tower.
The building of the bridge took years.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a physical place.
back_cards.example_en: The school building is very old.

back_cards.definition_en: A process of creating or developing.
back_cards.example_en: Team building helps us work better.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of resources or skills.
back_cards.example_en: We’re building a strong community here.
He serves in the military as a pilot.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe defense or warfare.
back_cards.example_en: The country increased its military budget.
The military base is nearby.
She runs her classroom with military precision.
Military strategy is key in this conflict.
I have an appointment with the doctor.

back_cards.definition_en: A person with a doctorate degree.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a doctor of philosophy.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to someone who heals.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor prescribed some medicine.
He’s a computer doctor, fixing laptops.
Doctor, can you check my injury?

back_cards.definition_en: Something done for enjoyment or purpose.
back_cards.example_en: Hiking is my favorite outdoor activity.

back_cards.definition_en: A task or event being carried out.
back_cards.example_en: The club planned a fun activity.
There’s a lot of activity in the park.
This activity helps kids learn math.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe movement or energy.
back_cards.example_en: The room was full of activity today.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to mean precisely or accurately.
back_cards.example_en: That’s exactly what I was thinking!

back_cards.definition_en: Used to ask for or give specifics.
back_cards.example_en: What exactly do you mean by that?
Exactly, that’s my point!

back_cards.definition_en: In a precise or correct manner.
back_cards.example_en: I followed the recipe exactly.
This is exactly the color I wanted.
The media covered the event widely.

back_cards.definition_en: News outlets like TV or newspapers.
back_cards.example_en: She spoke to the media about her book.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to digital content.
back_cards.example_en: Social media is popular these days.
The media influences public opinion.

back_cards.definition_en: Materials used in art or science.
back_cards.example_en: He works with mixed media in his art.

back_cards.definition_en: To fail to hit or reach something.
back_cards.example_en: I missed the target by an inch.

back_cards.definition_en: To feel sad about someone’s absence.
back_cards.example_en: I miss my family back home.

back_cards.definition_en: To fail to attend or experience.
back_cards.example_en: You don’t want to miss this concert.
I missed what you said, can you repeat?

back_cards.definition_en: Used to address an unmarried woman.
back_cards.example_en: Miss, your order is ready.

There’s evidence of rain coming soon.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in legal or scientific contexts.
back_cards.example_en: The evidence was clear in the trial.
His smile was evidence of his happiness.
This store sells organic products.
Her hard work was a product of dedication.
The new product sold out quickly.
The product of 5 and 3 is 15.
This wine is a product of Italy.
I didn’t realize how late it was.

back_cards.definition_en: To make something happen or real.
back_cards.example_en: She realized her dream of opening a café.
He realized his goal of running a marathon.
I realized my keys were missing.
They realized a profit from the sale.

back_cards.definition_en: To keep something for future use.
back_cards.example_en: I’m saving money for a new car.

back_cards.definition_en: To rescue or protect from harm.
back_cards.example_en: The lifeguard saved the swimmer.

Using less water saves resources.

back_cards.definition_en: The upper limb of the human body.
back_cards.example_en: I hurt my arm while lifting weights.

back_cards.definition_en: A branch or section of something.

The soldiers carried arms during the march.

back_cards.definition_en: To prepare or equip with something.
back_cards.example_en: They armed themselves for the hike.
The chair’s arm needs repair.

back_cards.definition_en: Tools or systems for practical use.
back_cards.example_en: This phone uses the latest technology.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of study or innovation.
back_cards.example_en: She’s studying technology at college.

back_cards.definition_en: Devices or machines used in daily life.
back_cards.example_en: Smart technology makes life easier.

back_cards.definition_en: To grab or seize something moving.
back_cards.example_en: I caught the ball during the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in time for something.
back_cards.example_en: I caught the bus just before it left.

That song really catches my ear.
She made a comment about the weather.

back_cards.definition_en: To give an opinion or feedback.
back_cards.example_en: He commented on my new haircut.

I left a comment on her blog post.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement to clarify or critique.
back_cards.example_en: His comment sparked a big debate.

back_cards.definition_en: A word or phrase for something.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of time, like a school session.
back_cards.example_en: The fall term starts in September.

back_cards.definition_en: Conditions or rules of an agreement.
back_cards.example_en: We agreed to the contract’s terms.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a specific duration.
back_cards.example_en: She served a term as president.

back_cards.definition_en: The hue or shade of something.
back_cards.example_en: Blue is my favorite color.

back_cards.definition_en: To add hue to something, like in art.
back_cards.example_en: The kids colored the picture with crayons.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe vibrancy or character.
back_cards.example_en: Her story added color to the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A visual property of an object.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s color is bright red.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to indicate diversity or variety.
back_cards.example_en: The festival was full of color and life.

back_cards.definition_en: To place something over or on top.

back_cards.definition_en: To report or describe an event.
back_cards.example_en: The news covered the storm all day.

back_cards.definition_en: To include or deal with something.

back_cards.definition_en: To explain or give details about something.

back_cards.definition_en: To depict a scene or event.

back_cards.definition_en: To estimate or suppose without certainty.
back_cards.example_en: I guess it’ll rain this afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a prediction or assumption.

This wine is my top choice.

back_cards.definition_en: The right or ability to choose.

back_cards.definition_en: A place or person providing information.
back_cards.example_en: She’s my source for local news.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a starting point.

My mom made cookies for us.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of endearment for a maternal figure.
back_cards.example_en: She’s like a mom to everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a nurturing person.

back_cards.definition_en: A parent who cares for family.
back_cards.example_en: Mom always knows what to say.

back_cards.definition_en: In a short amount of time.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be there soon, just wait.

We need to fix this soon.
Call me as soon as you can.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe an early occurrence.
back_cards.example_en: It got dark sooner than expected.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who leads an organization.
back_cards.example_en: She’s the director of the museum.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who directs a film or play.
back_cards.example_en: The director won an award for her movie.

back_cards.definition_en: A manager or overseer of a project.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the director of our new campaign.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a governing board.
back_cards.example_en: The board of directors meets monthly.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a leadership role.
back_cards.example_en: The director made the final decision.
This is an international music festival.
She works in international relations.
The company has an international office.
This issue is an international concern.
He flies on international routes.
The school has a strict no-phone rule.
The king ruled the country for years.
Follow the rules of the game.
Their team rules the league this year.
Honesty is the rule in our house.

back_cards.definition_en: An organized effort for a goal.
back_cards.example_en: She’s running a campaign for mayor.
The ad campaign was a big success.
The charity launched a campaign to help.
His campaign focused on education.
The general led a campaign in the war.
We sat on the ground for a picnic.

back_cards.definition_en: A reason or basis for something.
back_cards.example_en: She had no ground to complain.
We need to cover a lot of ground today.
My parents grounded me for a week.

back_cards.definition_en: An area used for a specific purpose.
back_cards.example_en: This is the soccer ground for practice.

back_cards.definition_en: A process of choosing by voting.
back_cards.example_en: The election for mayor is next week.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a political event.
back_cards.example_en: She’s running in the national election.

The election results were surprising.
The club held an election for president.

back_cards.definition_en: A sound used as a pause in speech.
back_cards.example_en: Uh, I’m not sure what to say.
Uh, can you repeat that one more time?
I was, uh, thinking about leaving.
Uh, I think we’re lost.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to stall while thinking.
back_cards.example_en: Uh, let me check my schedule.
Can you check the list for my name?
I paid the bill with a check.
He checked his speed on the highway.

Let’s check if the door is locked.

back_cards.definition_en: A sheet of paper in a book.
back_cards.example_en: Turn to page 50 in your textbook.
I found this on a news page online.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a section of content.
back_cards.example_en: Check the last page for details.

back_cards.definition_en: To call someone via a pager.

back_cards.definition_en: To engage in a struggle or battle.
back_cards.example_en: He fought bravely in the boxing match.

back_cards.definition_en: A strong effort for a cause.
back_cards.example_en: She’s leading the fight for equality.
We need to fight against pollution.
They had a fight over the bill.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize a thing or animal.

The cat cleaned itself after eating.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to stress a thing’s identity.
back_cards.example_en: The city itself is very vibrant.

The view itself is worth the trip.
I have a math test tomorrow.
We need to test this new software.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to measure ability or quality.
back_cards.example_en: The driving test was really tough.
They tested the water for pollution.
This project is a real test of patience.
The doctor saw a patient this morning.
She’s very patient with her students.
You need to be patient in traffic.
The patient is recovering well.
Be patient, the bus will come soon.
This factory produces car parts.
I bought some produce at the market.
The tree produces apples every year.
She produced her ID at the gate.

back_cards.definition_en: To oversee the creation of media.
back_cards.example_en: He produced a hit TV show.
I’m certain we locked the door.
Certain people need to apologize.
She’s certain about her decision.
There’s a certain charm to this town.
I’m certain you’ll love this book.
Take whatever you need from the fridge.
Whatever, I don’t care what we eat.
Just do whatever, it’s up to you.
Whatever happens, I’ll be there.
Whatever she said, I didn’t hear it.
I ate half of the pizza.
The glass is half full of water.

back_cards.definition_en: A portion of time or distance.
back_cards.example_en: We’re halfway through the movie.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe an approximate time.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be there in half an hour.

I watched a funny video online.
She posted a video of her cat.

back_cards.definition_en: A film or clip for entertainment.
back_cards.example_en: This video game has awesome graphics.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to visual media.
back_cards.example_en: The video of the speech went viral.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause something to move quickly.
back_cards.example_en: She threw her bag on the couch.

back_cards.definition_en: To host or organize an event.
back_cards.example_en: They’re throwing a big party tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a sudden action.
back_cards.example_en: He threw a punch in the fight.

back_cards.definition_en: The number three in a sequence.
back_cards.example_en: She came in third in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: A level or stage in a process.
back_cards.example_en: The third chapter is my favorite.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to rank or order something.

back_cards.definition_en: To relax or take a break.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of sleep or inactivity.

back_cards.definition_en: Done or made just before now.
back_cards.example_en: The recent update fixed the app.

back_cards.definition_en: Able to be used or obtained.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage or part of a process.

back_cards.definition_en: A single action toward a goal.

back_cards.definition_en: A surface for walking, like stairs.

back_cards.definition_en: Prepared for an action or event.

back_cards.definition_en: A true account of events or experiences.

The newspaper published a story about the local election.

back_cards.definition_en: A description of events in a movie or book.
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s story kept me glued to the screen.

back_cards.definition_en: A level or floor of a building (used regionally).
back_cards.example_en: The office is on the fifth story of the building.
I have two meetings scheduled for today.
Today, people rely heavily on smartphones.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to emphasize the current moment in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Today is the day we finish this project!

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to recent or ongoing events.
back_cards.example_en: The weather today is perfect for a picnic.

back_cards.definition_en: In the context of news or updates.
back_cards.example_en: Did you hear what happened in the news today?
She just got a new job at the hospital.
Fixing the sink is my job this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A role or position in an organization.
back_cards.example_en: His job as a teacher keeps him busy.
It’s your job to take out the trash.
The mechanic did a great job on my car.
We need to move the couch to the other room.

back_cards.definition_en: To relocate to a new place.
back_cards.example_en: They’re planning to move to a new city next month.

back_cards.definition_en: To take action or make progress.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s move on this idea before it’s too late.

back_cards.definition_en: To change emotions or inspire feelings.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech really moved the audience.

back_cards.definition_en: A strategic action in a game or plan.
back_cards.example_en: His next move in chess was brilliant.

back_cards.definition_en: Something that is necessary or required.
back_cards.example_en: You must wear a helmet when biking.
She’s not here, so she must be running late.
We must finish this report by tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate obligation in formal settings.
back_cards.example_en: All visitors must sign in at the front desk.
You must try the new coffee shop downtown!
The food at that restaurant was really bad.
Smoking is bad for your health.
I’m feeling bad about missing the party.
The storm caused some bad damage to the house.
He’s not bad at basketball for a beginner.

back_cards.definition_en: A person you know and like spending time with.
back_cards.example_en: My best friend and I go hiking every weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who supports or helps you.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been a good friend during tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: A person you connect with socially.
back_cards.example_en: I made a new friend at the book club.

back_cards.definition_en: A term used to address someone casually.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, friend, want to grab some coffee?
He’s my gaming friend; we play online every night.

back_cards.definition_en: Throughout the time of an event.
back_cards.example_en: I fell asleep during the movie.

back_cards.definition_en: At some point in a period of time.
back_cards.example_en: She called me during lunch to catch up.

back_cards.definition_en: In the course of an activity.
back_cards.example_en: He got injured during the soccer game.
We chatted during the long car ride.
The store is open during regular business hours.
Let’s begin the meeting with a quick update.

back_cards.definition_en: To take the first step in a process.
back_cards.example_en: She began her workout with some stretches.
The festival begins tomorrow morning.

back_cards.definition_en: To initiate a conversation or topic.
back_cards.example_en: He began by thanking everyone for coming.

back_cards.definition_en: To start learning or trying something.
back_cards.example_en: I’m excited to begin my guitar lessons.
I love my family more than anything.

back_cards.definition_en: Great enjoyment or passion for something.
back_cards.example_en: She loves painting in her free time.
They fell in love during college.
Goodnight, love, see you tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: Enthusiasm for an activity or thing.
back_cards.example_en: I love how this new phone takes pictures!

back_cards.definition_en: Every one of two or more items or people.
back_cards.example_en: Each student got a certificate for their work.
We checked each box to make sure nothing was missing.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to all members of a group.
back_cards.example_en: Each of us has a role in the project.

back_cards.definition_en: In the context of sharing or distribution.
back_cards.example_en: They gave each kid a slice of cake.

back_cards.definition_en: To describe repeated actions for individuals.
back_cards.example_en: She greeted each guest with a smile.
Can you hold my bag for a second?

back_cards.definition_en: To keep or maintain something in place.
back_cards.example_en: This shelf can hold up to 50 pounds.

back_cards.definition_en: To conduct or organize an event.
back_cards.example_en: They’re going to hold a meeting tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To contain or have capacity for.
back_cards.example_en: This jar can hold a gallon of water.

back_cards.definition_en: To wait or pause, especially on the phone.
back_cards.example_en: Please hold while I transfer your call.

back_cards.definition_en: Not the same as something else.
back_cards.example_en: This coffee tastes different from the usual brand.

back_cards.definition_en: Unique or distinct in some way.
back_cards.example_en: Each city has a different vibe.
We tried three different restaurants this week.
Her approach to the problem was different but effective.
They come from different backgrounds but get along great.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the United States or its people.
back_cards.example_en: American culture is known for its diversity.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a citizen of the United States.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an American who moved here last year.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to American history or traditions.
back_cards.example_en: We watched an American football game on Thanksgiving.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to products or styles from the U.S.
back_cards.example_en: I love the taste of American pancakes with syrup.
The American embassy is hosting a cultural event.
I have a little garden in my backyard.
My little brother is starting school this year.
I’m a little tired after the long day.
Look at that little puppy; it’s so cute!

back_cards.definition_en: A short amount of time or distance.
back_cards.example_en: Wait a little, and I’ll be right there.

back_cards.definition_en: Earlier in time than something else.
back_cards.example_en: I need to finish this before lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: In front of someone or something.
back_cards.example_en: She stood before the audience to give her speech.
We met up before the concert started.
I’ve never seen this movie before.
I’d choose coffee before tea any day.
Have you ever been to New York?

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis in questions or statements.
back_cards.example_en: What’s the best movie you’ve ever seen?

back_cards.definition_en: In all experiences up to now.
back_cards.example_en: This is the worst storm we’ve ever had.
She’s ever hopeful about her team’s chances.
I don’t think I’ll ever understand calculus.

back_cards.definition_en: A single unit of language with meaning.
back_cards.example_en: What’s the word for this in English?
I give you my word I’ll be there.
Have you heard the word about the new store?
The coach’s word was to practice harder.
Can I have a word with you privately?
It’s a fact that the Earth orbits the Sun.
She checked the facts before writing the article.
The fact is, we need more funding to continue.
I love hiking, and that’s a fact!

back_cards.definition_en: An objective detail in a discussion.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s stick to the facts during this debate.

back_cards.definition_en: To look at and understand written text.
back_cards.example_en: I read a great book last weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To say words aloud from text.
back_cards.example_en: She read the poem to the class.
I can read his mood just by looking at him.

back_cards.definition_en: To study or learn about something.
back_cards.example_en: He’s reading history at college this year.

back_cards.definition_en: To check or review written content.
back_cards.example_en: Can you read my essay and give feedback?
Do you need anything from the store?

back_cards.definition_en: Used in questions for any possibility.
back_cards.example_en: Is there anything I can help you with?
I don’t know anything about fixing cars.
I’m up for anything this weekend!

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to any amount or type.
back_cards.example_en: You can borrow anything from my closet.
There’s nothing in the fridge to eat.
Don’t worry, it’s nothing serious.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to dismiss concern or interest.
back_cards.example_en: What’s wrong? Oh, nothing, I’m fine.

back_cards.definition_en: An absence of results or progress.
back_cards.example_en: We searched but found nothing useful.
He knows nothing about cooking.
I’m sure we’ll finish the project on time.
Sure, I’ll meet you at the park.
It’s sure cold out here today!
Sure, you can borrow my phone.
A sure sign of spring is the blooming flowers.
We stayed in a small cabin by the lake.
It’s just a small problem, nothing major.
My small cousin loves playing hide and seek.
They run a small business from home.
He lives a small but happy life.
I’m going on vacation next month.

back_cards.definition_en: One of the twelve divisions of a year.
back_cards.example_en: February is the shortest month.

back_cards.definition_en: A timeframe for planning or events.
back_cards.example_en: We’ve been working on this for a month.

back_cards.definition_en: A recurring time period for payments.
back_cards.example_en: The rent is due at the start of the month.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to measure progress or duration.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been learning piano for six months.

back_cards.definition_en: A planned series of events or activities.
back_cards.example_en: The community center has a great summer program.
This program helps you edit photos easily.

back_cards.definition_en: A broadcast, like a TV or radio show.
back_cards.example_en: I watch that news program every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or schedule for achieving a goal.
back_cards.example_en: The school started a program to reduce bullying.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of instructions for a computer.
back_cards.example_en: He wrote a program to track his expenses.
Maybe we’ll go to the beach this weekend.
I’m not sure, maybe I left my keys at home.
Maybe you could try calling her later.
I’ll think about it—maybe I’ll join you.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to soften a suggestion.
back_cards.example_en: Maybe we should take a break now.
The cat is hiding under the table.
This shirt costs under twenty dollars.

back_cards.definition_en: Subject to a rule or authority.
back_cards.example_en: She’s working under a tight deadline.
The bridge is under construction right now.

back_cards.definition_en: In a lower position or rank.
back_cards.example_en: He serves under the team leader.

back_cards.definition_en: A company or organization for profit.
back_cards.example_en: She runs a small business selling handmade jewelry.
He’s in town for business meetings.
My business is fixing cars.
This whole mess is none of your business.

back_cards.definition_en: The activity of buying and selling.
back_cards.example_en: The store does good business during the holidays.
I’m so tired; I just want to go home.
We’re a home of five, including the dog.

back_cards.definition_en: A place of origin or belonging.
back_cards.example_en: She calls Chicago her home.
This café feels like home to me.

back_cards.definition_en: The goal or end point in games.
back_cards.example_en: He slid into home plate to score.

back_cards.definition_en: A type or category of something.
back_cards.example_en: What kind of pizza do you want?
It was kind of her to help me move.
This kind of fish lives in deep water.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to soften or qualify a statement.
back_cards.example_en: I’m kind of busy right now.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to describe personality traits.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the kind of guy who always helps out.

back_cards.definition_en: To bring something to an end.
back_cards.example_en: Can you stop the music for a minute?
The car stopped at the red light.
We need to stop the leak before it gets worse.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where a vehicle pauses.
back_cards.example_en: The bus stop is just around the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: To pause briefly during an activity.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s stop for coffee on the way.

back_cards.definition_en: To give money for goods or services.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll pay for dinner tonight.
This job pays well, but it’s tough.
He’ll pay for breaking the rules.
You need to pay attention in class.
It pays to plan your trip in advance.

back_cards.definition_en: To learn about a subject through reading or research.
back_cards.example_en: I need to study for my math test tomorrow.
The study showed that exercise improves mood.
She studied the map to find the best route.

back_cards.definition_en: A room used for work or learning.
back_cards.example_en: He’s in the study working on his novel.

back_cards.definition_en: To prepare for an academic goal.
back_cards.example_en: They study together every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: From a past time until now.
back_cards.example_en: I haven’t seen her since last summer.

back_cards.definition_en: Because or as a result of.
back_cards.example_en: Since it’s raining, let’s stay inside.

back_cards.definition_en: From a specific point in the past.
back_cards.example_en: He’s been working here since 2018.

back_cards.definition_en: In the time after an event.
back_cards.example_en: A lot has changed since we moved here.
Since you’re free, want to grab lunch?
We need to address the issue of late deliveries.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic for discussion or debate.
back_cards.example_en: The issue of climate change is urgent.
I read the latest issue of that journal.
They’ll issue new ID cards next week.
He’s dealing with some trust issues.

back_cards.definition_en: A word or phrase identifying a person or thing.
back_cards.example_en: My name is Alex, nice to meet you.

back_cards.definition_en: To give a title or label to something.
back_cards.example_en: They named their dog Max.
She’s made a name for herself in fashion.
Can you name the capital of France?

back_cards.definition_en: A term used for a person or group.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the best name in local photography.
I have an idea for a new app.
She has no idea how to fix the car.
His idea is to start saving early.
My idea of fun is a day at the beach.
I get the idea, but can you explain more?

back_cards.definition_en: A space or area in a building.
back_cards.example_en: This room is perfect for a home office.

back_cards.definition_en: A bedroom or specific area in a house.
back_cards.example_en: My room is upstairs on the left.
Is there room for one more in the car?

back_cards.definition_en: A place for a specific purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The waiting room was packed with people.
There’s room to improve this project.
Forty percent of the class passed the test.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express a rate or share.
back_cards.example_en: The store offered a 20 percent discount.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to measure data or statistics.
back_cards.example_en: Unemployment dropped by two percent.

back_cards.definition_en: In financial contexts for interest or growth.
back_cards.example_en: The bank offers a three percent interest rate.
A small percent of voters changed their minds.
The store is too far to walk to.

back_cards.definition_en: To a great extent or degree.
back_cards.example_en: This is far better than the old version.
We’ve come far since starting this project.
It’s far too cold to go outside today.
Her skills are far ahead of mine.

back_cards.definition_en: At a distance from a place.
back_cards.example_en: I’m going away for the weekend.
Sorry, the manager is away right now.

back_cards.definition_en: To remove or get rid of something.
back_cards.example_en: Please put the dishes away after dinner.
She kept working away on her painting.
The beach is only a mile away.

back_cards.definition_en: A rule established by a government.
back_cards.example_en: Breaking the law can lead to a fine.
She’s studying law at university.
The law of gravity explains why things fall.

back_cards.definition_en: A body of rules for a group.
back_cards.example_en: This club has its own law for members.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement of fact or principle.
back_cards.example_en: It’s the law of supply and demand.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to state a fact or correct a misconception.
back_cards.example_en: I thought it was expensive, but it’s actually cheap.
She actually finished the race in first place!

back_cards.definition_en: In reality, as opposed to appearance.
back_cards.example_en: He looks calm, but he’s actually nervous.
I’ve actually never been to that city.
Actually, I meant tomorrow, not today.
They bought a large house in the suburbs.
The company made a large profit this year.
Can you give me a large cup of coffee?
She has a large network of friends.
A large crowd gathered for the concert.
It’s raining, but I’m going out though.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a contrasting idea.
back_cards.example_en: She’s shy, though she’s great at public speaking.

back_cards.definition_en: As a way to soften a statement.
back_cards.example_en: I don’t agree, but it’s okay though.
He’s busy, though he’ll make time for you.

back_cards.definition_en: At the end of a sentence for emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: It’s a tough job, I’ll do it though.

back_cards.definition_en: To supply or give something needed.
back_cards.example_en: The school provides free lunches for students.
They provide Wi-Fi in the café.
His job provides for his family’s needs.
Can you provide more details about the plan?
The company provides training for new hires.
I don’t want to lose my keys again.

back_cards.definition_en: To fail to win a game or competition.
back_cards.example_en: Our team might lose if we don’t practice.

back_cards.definition_en: To misplace or be unable to find.
back_cards.example_en: She lost her phone somewhere in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: To experience a reduction or decline.
back_cards.example_en: The company lost money this quarter.
Don’t lose your chance to apply for this job.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to do or control something.
back_cards.example_en: The president has the power to veto laws.
The storm knocked out power to the town.
Her voice has a lot of power when she sings.
He’s a person with a lot of power in the industry.

back_cards.definition_en: A mathematical operation, like raising to an exponent.
back_cards.example_en: Three to the power of two is nine.
The kids are playing in the backyard.
She’s a smart kid with big dreams.

back_cards.definition_en: To tease or joke with someone.
back_cards.example_en: I’m just kidding; don’t take it seriously!

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a younger sibling or friend.
back_cards.example_en: My little kid brother is always following me.
The farm has a few kids running around.

back_cards.definition_en: A conflict between nations or groups.
back_cards.example_en: The history class discussed World War II.
There’s a war on plastic waste in our city.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of hostility or competition.
back_cards.example_en: The two companies are in a pricing war.
Veterans shared their stories from the war.
We’re fighting a war against misinformation.

back_cards.definition_en: To grasp the meaning of something.
back_cards.example_en: I understand what you’re trying to say.
She’s quick to understand new concepts.
I understand how hard this must be for you.
He understands computers better than anyone.
I understand his silence as agreement.

back_cards.definition_en: The top part of the body.
back_cards.example_en: She wore a hat on her head.

back_cards.definition_en: The leader or person in charge.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the head of the marketing team.

back_cards.definition_en: The front or top of something.
back_cards.example_en: The head of the table is reserved for guests.
We’re heading to the beach this afternoon.
Let’s keep our heads on the main goal.
My mother makes the best apple pie.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of affection for a maternal figure.
back_cards.example_en: She’s like a mother to everyone in the group.

back_cards.definition_en: The source or origin of something.
back_cards.example_en: This river is the mother of the valley’s ecosystem.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman who nurtures or cares.
back_cards.example_en: Our coach is the mother of the team.
That was the mother of all storms!
Is that diamond real or fake?
She’s a real friend who’s always there.
We’re in real trouble if we miss the deadline.
The movie is based on a real story.
That was a real good game tonight!

back_cards.definition_en: The highest quality or most excellent.
back_cards.example_en: This is the best pizza I’ve ever had.
The best option is to leave early.
Best of luck on your new job!
She was voted the best singer in the contest.
I did my best to finish on time.

back_cards.definition_en: A group working together toward a goal.
back_cards.example_en: Our team won the championship last year.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of colleagues in a workplace.
back_cards.example_en: The design team is meeting this afternoon.
We need a team to organize the event.
She’s the captain of the soccer team.

back_cards.definition_en: A cooperative unit in any context.
back_cards.example_en: The rescue team saved the hikers.
Her eyes sparkled in the sunlight.
All eyes were on the new performer.
In my eyes, this plan makes sense.

back_cards.definition_en: The center of something, like a storm.
back_cards.example_en: We’re in the eye of the hurricane now.

back_cards.definition_en: A small hole or loop, as in a needle.
back_cards.example_en: Thread the string through the eye of the needle.
The bridge is a mile long.
The movie was too long for my taste.
We waited a long time for the bus.

back_cards.definition_en: To desire or yearn for something.
back_cards.example_en: I long for a quiet day at home.
She’s been a long-time friend of mine.

back_cards.definition_en: One part or edge of something.
back_cards.example_en: The house is on the left side of the street.

back_cards.definition_en: A position in an argument or conflict.
back_cards.example_en: Which side are you on in this debate?

back_cards.definition_en: A surface or aspect of an object.
back_cards.example_en: Paint the other side of the fence too.

back_cards.definition_en: A team or group in competition.
back_cards.example_en: Our side scored the winning goal.
I’ll have fries as a side with my burger.
Can you get me a glass of water?

back_cards.definition_en: A body of liquid, like a river or lake.
back_cards.example_en: The water in the lake is crystal clear.
I need to water the plants this evening.

back_cards.definition_en: A resource used in daily tasks.
back_cards.example_en: We’re running low on hot water.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a watery environment.
back_cards.example_en: The fish thrives in cold water.

back_cards.definition_en: Having lived for a short time.
back_cards.example_en: The young kids were playing in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: Youthful or having a youthful appearance.
back_cards.example_en: She looks so young for her age.
The young company is growing fast.
He’s a young artist with a lot of potential.
The mother bird fed her young.

back_cards.definition_en: To stay in place until something happens.
back_cards.example_en: We had to wait an hour for the bus.
Wait, let me grab my jacket first.
I can’t wait to see the new movie!

back_cards.definition_en: To serve as a waiter or attendant.
back_cards.example_en: She waits tables at the diner on weekends.

back_cards.definition_en: To hold off for a better opportunity.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s wait until the price drops.
The food here is okay, but not amazing.
Okay, I’ll meet you at six.
Don’t worry, I’m okay after the fall.
It’s okay to borrow my book.
We’re leaving now, okay?

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to two things or people together.
back_cards.example_en: Both of my parents are teachers.
I like both chocolate and vanilla ice cream.
Both teams played an amazing game.
You can call or text, both work for me.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to include two entities.
back_cards.example_en: Both the dog and the cat are sleeping.

back_cards.definition_en: Up to now or the present time.
back_cards.example_en: I haven’t finished my homework yet.
It’s cold, yet the sun is shining.

back_cards.definition_en: At some point in the future.
back_cards.example_en: We’ll get there yet, just keep trying.
I’m not ready to give up yet.
The results aren’t in yet.
Let’s meet at the café at noon.
I can’t wait to meet your new puppy!

back_cards.definition_en: To satisfy a requirement or goal.
back_cards.example_en: We need to meet the project deadline.
The club meets every Tuesday evening.
She’s ready to meet any challenge.
The restaurant’s service was excellent.

back_cards.definition_en: A system providing a public need.
back_cards.example_en: The bus service runs every 15 minutes.
We attended the Sunday morning service.
I called tech service to fix my laptop.
He served in the armed services for years.
This area of town is known for its shops.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a surface or place.
back_cards.example_en: The picnic area is by the lake.

back_cards.definition_en: A field of study or activity.
back_cards.example_en: Her area of expertise is biology.
The fire spread to a wide area.

back_cards.definition_en: A designated space for a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The kids are playing in the play area.
This meeting is important, so don’t be late.
It’s important to drink water every day.
She’s an important figure in the community.
Your feedback is important to us.
Teamwork is important for this project.
She’s the nicest person I’ve ever met.

back_cards.definition_en: A character or role in a story.
back_cards.example_en: The book is written from the person’s perspective.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to someone unspecified.
back_cards.example_en: A person called asking for you.

back_cards.definition_en: An individual in legal or formal contexts.
back_cards.example_en: Only one person can sign the contract.
He’s not a morning person at all.
Hey, how’s it going?

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express surprise or excitement.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, you won the raffle!

back_cards.definition_en: A casual way to start a conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, have you seen the new movie?

back_cards.definition_en: To call out or alert someone.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, watch out for that car!

back_cards.definition_en: An informal way to address a group.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, everyone, let’s get started!
I want to thank you for your help.

back_cards.definition_en: To show appreciation for an action.

This book is among my favorites.
The prize was split among the three winners.
He felt at ease among his colleagues.

back_cards.definition_en: Being one of several in a context.
back_cards.example_en: Among all the options, this is the cheapest.

back_cards.definition_en: The front part of a person’s head.
back_cards.example_en: She has a big smile on her face.

back_cards.definition_en: To confront or deal with something.
back_cards.example_en: I need to face my fears and try again.

back_cards.definition_en: The surface or side of an object.
back_cards.example_en: The face of the clock is cracked.
We’ll face some challenges in this project.
He had a serious face during the meeting.
The park is open to the public.
She made a public statement on the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: Funded or managed by the government.
back_cards.example_en: Public schools offer free education.
Public safety is a top priority here.
His speech went public on social media.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop living or cease to exist.
back_cards.example_en: The plant will die without enough water.
My phone battery died during the call.
The noise died down after midnight.

back_cards.definition_en: To be extremely eager or desperate.
back_cards.example_en: I’m dying to see the new movie!

back_cards.definition_en: To deteriorate or come to an end.
back_cards.example_en: The old traditions are starting to die out.
I’m craving Italian food tonight.
She packed some food for the picnic.
Mexican food is my favorite.
We donated food to the local shelter.
The festival had amazing street food.

back_cards.definition_en: In addition to or besides something.
back_cards.example_en: What else do we need from the store?
I don’t want to go anywhere else.
If you’re not free, someone else can help.
Call me if anything else comes up.

I’m taking a history class this semester.
This house has a fascinating history.
She has a history of helping others.

back_cards.definition_en: The sequence of events over time.
back_cards.example_en: The history of this town is well-documented.
He’s a history major at the university.
I need to buy new shoes for work.
She bought a used car last weekend.
I don’t buy his excuse for being late.

back_cards.definition_en: To gain through effort or cost.
back_cards.example_en: His hard work bought him some respect.
We buy our groceries from the local market.

back_cards.definition_en: The outcome or consequence of something.
back_cards.example_en: The result of the game was a tie.
Her test results were excellent.
His injury was the result of an accident.

back_cards.definition_en: A solution or finding from analysis.
back_cards.example_en: The study’s results will be published soon.
Delays can result from bad weather.

back_cards.definition_en: The time from midnight to noon.
back_cards.example_en: I go for a run every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: The early part of the day.
back_cards.example_en: She’s not a morning person at all.

back_cards.definition_en: The start of a new day.
back_cards.example_en: The morning brought clear skies.
He reads the news every morning.
The morning air feels so crisp.

back_cards.definition_en: A mother or father of a child.
back_cards.example_en: My parents are coming over for dinner.
The foster parent adopted the child.

back_cards.definition_en: The source or origin of something.
back_cards.example_en: This company is the parent of several brands.
She’s a single parent to two kids.
Parents often worry about their kids’ future.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where business is conducted.
back_cards.example_en: I’m heading to the office for a meeting.
Her office is on the third floor.

back_cards.definition_en: A position of authority or duty.
back_cards.example_en: He’s running for public office this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A department or branch of work.
back_cards.example_en: The ticket office opens at nine.

back_cards.definition_en: The staff or function of a workplace.
back_cards.example_en: The office is planning a holiday party.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of lessons or studies.
back_cards.example_en: I’m taking a cooking course this summer.

back_cards.definition_en: The path or direction of something.
back_cards.example_en: The river follows a winding course.

back_cards.definition_en: A procedure or way of acting.
back_cards.example_en: The best course is to apologize quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a meal served separately.
back_cards.example_en: The main course was delicious.

back_cards.definition_en: A route or area for activities.
back_cards.example_en: The golf course is open all weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause something to be delivered.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll send you the files by email.
She sent a letter to her friend.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause someone to go somewhere.
back_cards.example_en: They sent him to the principal’s office.
Can you send me the meeting details?
The rocket was sent into orbit.

back_cards.definition_en: The systematic study of a subject.
back_cards.example_en: She’s doing research on climate change.
His research led to a medical breakthrough.
I need to research flights for my trip.
The university funds cancer research.
We’re conducting research for the new product.

back_cards.definition_en: To move on foot at a regular pace.
back_cards.example_en: I walk to work every morning.
Let’s walk in the park this afternoon.
I’ll walk you to the bus stop.

back_cards.definition_en: To follow a path or route.
back_cards.example_en: The trail walks along the riverbank.

back_cards.definition_en: To move through or complete something.
back_cards.example_en: She walked me through the new software.

back_cards.definition_en: A movable barrier for entering or exiting.
back_cards.example_en: Please close the door behind you.
The store’s front door is always open.

back_cards.definition_en: A means of opportunity or access.
back_cards.example_en: This job opened a door to a new career.

back_cards.definition_en: The entry to a room or building.
back_cards.example_en: She knocked on the door before entering.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to start or engage.
back_cards.example_en: His speech was a door to new discussions.

back_cards.definition_en: The color of snow or milk.
back_cards.example_en: She wore a white dress to the wedding.
His face turned white when he heard the news.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a racial or ethnic group.
back_cards.example_en: The neighborhood is mostly white.
The white sand on the beach was stunning.

back_cards.definition_en: Blank or empty, as in paper.
back_cards.example_en: I need a white sheet for this project.

back_cards.definition_en: More than two but not many.
back_cards.example_en: I called her several times this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: A small number of items or people.
back_cards.example_en: Several students joined the new club.
There are several options to choose from.
We saw several birds in the tree.

back_cards.definition_en: Multiple but not a large amount.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been to Paris several times.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where legal cases are heard.
back_cards.example_en: The case will be tried in court tomorrow.
We played basketball on the court yesterday.
The king held court with his advisors.
The Supreme Court made a historic ruling.
He’s trying to court her with flowers.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase in size or develop.
back_cards.example_en: The plant will grow if you water it.
They grow corn on their farm.
Her confidence grew after the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: To expand or increase over time.
back_cards.example_en: The company continues to grow every year.
Kids grow so fast these days.

back_cards.definition_en: Of higher quality or more desirable.
back_cards.example_en: This pizza is better than the one we had last week.
I’m feeling better after some rest.
You’d better leave before it gets dark.
She’s better at math than I am.
We need a better plan for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Not closed or accessible to all.
back_cards.example_en: The store is open until nine tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: Receptive to new ideas or opportunities.
back_cards.example_en: I’m open to suggestions for the party.
They sat in an open field under the stars.
Can you open the map so we can see it?
Wait a moment, I’ll be right back.
That was a defining moment in her career.
At that moment, the rain started pouring.
Let’s take a moment to think about this.
This is the moment to ask for a raise.

back_cards.definition_en: Containing or covering as part of a whole.
back_cards.example_en: The price, including tax, is twenty dollars.

back_cards.definition_en: Adding as part of a group.
back_cards.example_en: Everyone, including me, loved the movie.
The menu includes pizza, including vegetarian options.

back_cards.definition_en: As part of a broader category.
back_cards.example_en: All staff, including interns, must attend.
The package includes everything, including delivery.
I’ll consider your offer before deciding.

back_cards.definition_en: To regard or view in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: She’s considered a leader in her field.

He’s considering a career change soon.

The keys are within the drawer.
We’ll finish the project within a week.
Try to keep expenses within the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: In the scope or range of.
back_cards.example_en: This topic is within my area of expertise.
The decision was made within the team.

back_cards.definition_en: The number two in a sequence.
back_cards.example_en: She came in second in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of time, 1/60 of a minute.
back_cards.example_en: Wait a second, I’m almost ready.

back_cards.definition_en: Next after the first in importance.
back_cards.example_en: This is my second favorite book.
I’ll have a second helping of pie.

back_cards.definition_en: After the expected or proper time.
back_cards.example_en: I was late for work because of traffic.

back_cards.definition_en: Near the end of a period.
back_cards.example_en: It’s getting late; we should head home.
The late mayor was honored at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring toward the end of something.
back_cards.example_en: The meeting ran into the late afternoon.
The train is running late today.

back_cards.definition_en: A public road in a city or town.
back_cards.example_en: I live on Maple Street near the park.

back_cards.definition_en: The people or culture of a neighborhood.
back_cards.example_en: The street was buzzing with festival energy.

back_cards.definition_en: A thoroughfare for vehicles and pedestrians.
back_cards.example_en: We crossed the street to get to the shop.

back_cards.definition_en: An area known for specific activities.
back_cards.example_en: Wall Street is famous for finance.

back_cards.definition_en: A place of everyday public life.
back_cards.example_en: You hear all kinds of stories on the street.
The concert in the park is free.
You’re free to choose your own path.
Are you free to meet this afternoon?
The prisoners were set free after years.
I’m finally free from that stressful job.

back_cards.definition_en: All people in a group or place.
back_cards.example_en: Everyone at the party had a great time.
Everyone needs to sign the attendance sheet.
Everyone in town knows about the festival.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a general group.
back_cards.example_en: Everyone loves a good movie night.
Everyone on the team contributed to the win.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of rules or principles.
back_cards.example_en: The company has a strict no-smoking policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or course of action.
back_cards.example_en: Their policy is to promote from within.
The new policy supports renewable energy.
I need to review my insurance policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of furniture with a flat surface.
back_cards.example_en: We sat around the table for dinner.
The table in the report shows sales figures.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for discussion or negotiation.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s bring this issue to the table.

back_cards.definition_en: A surface for activities or work.
back_cards.example_en: She set her books on the table.
They decided to table the proposal for now.
I’m sorry for forgetting your birthday.
I feel sorry for him after his loss.
Sorry, can you repeat that one more time?

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a poor or unfortunate state.
back_cards.example_en: This is a sorry excuse for a sandwich.
Sorry, but we’re all out of ice cream.
I really care about how you’re feeling.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of providing for someone’s needs.
back_cards.example_en: She takes great care of her plants.
Handle the glass with care; it’s fragile.
The kids are in my care this weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of affection or regard.
back_cards.example_en: He shows care for his community through volunteering.

back_cards.definition_en: Not high in height or position.
back_cards.example_en: The shelf is too low for me to reach.
We’re running low on milk.
She spoke in a low voice during the movie.
I’ve been feeling low since the bad news.
They offered a low price for the car.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or member of the species.
back_cards.example_en: Humans have lived here for centuries.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to people or their nature.
back_cards.example_en: The study focuses on human behavior.
Her human touch made everyone feel welcome.
It’s only human to make mistakes.
We need human judgment for this decision.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to make a polite request.
back_cards.example_en: Can you please pass the salt?
Her performance will please the audience.
Please let me know if you’re coming.
Please, just listen to what I’m saying.
I aim to please with my cooking!

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of expectation or desire.
back_cards.example_en: I hope we win the game tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: To wish for something to happen.
back_cards.example_en: She hopes to visit Paris next year.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of optimism or possibility.
back_cards.example_en: There’s still hope for a better future.

back_cards.definition_en: To rely on or trust in something.
back_cards.example_en: I hope you’re right about the weather.

back_cards.definition_en: In accordance with fact or reality.
back_cards.example_en: Is it true that you’re moving?

His prediction turned out to be true.
He stayed true to his promises.
The copy is true to the original.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of actions to achieve a result.
back_cards.example_en: The hiring process takes about a month.

back_cards.definition_en: To handle or deal with systematically.
back_cards.example_en: We need to process these orders quickly.
Learning is a process that takes time.

back_cards.definition_en: A method or system of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: Their process for making coffee is unique.
The project is still in process.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who instructs or educates.
back_cards.example_en: My teacher explained the math problem clearly.

He’s a great teacher for young kids.

back_cards.definition_en: Facts or information used for analysis.
back_cards.example_en: The data shows a rise in sales.

The app collects data on user habits.
Her data supports the new theory.
The system processes data in real time.

The café offers free Wi-Fi to customers.

back_cards.definition_en: To express willingness to do something.
back_cards.example_en: I can offer to drive you home.
The store has a two-for-one offer.

back_cards.definition_en: The end of life for a person or organism.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of dying or being killed.
back_cards.example_en: The news reported a sudden death in town.
The death of the project disappointed everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A cause of loss of life.
back_cards.example_en: Smoking can lead to an early death.
I ate the whole pizza by myself.
The whole team agreed on the plan.
She stayed awake the whole night.
The vase is still whole after the fall.
The whole cost was under a hundred bucks.
She has a lot of experience in teaching.
That road trip was an amazing experience.
I experienced joy at the concert.
He lacks experience in public speaking.
Meeting her was a life-changing experience.

back_cards.definition_en: A detailed proposal for doing something.
back_cards.example_en: We made a plan for the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or intend to do something.
back_cards.example_en: I’m planning to visit my parents soon.
The plan is to finish by Friday.
The architect showed us the house plan.

back_cards.definition_en: An organized approach to a goal.
back_cards.example_en: Her plan to save money worked well.

back_cards.definition_en: Not difficult or requiring little effort.
back_cards.example_en: This recipe is easy to follow.
Take it easy, there’s no rush.
The test was easier than I expected.
Life feels easy when you’re on vacation.
She’s easy to talk to about anything.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of learning or teaching.
back_cards.example_en: Education is key to a better future.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of schooling or instruction.
back_cards.example_en: Public education is free in this state.
Her education includes a master’s degree.

back_cards.definition_en: The field of teaching or learning.
back_cards.example_en: He works in education as a counselor.

back_cards.definition_en: Training or development in a skill.
back_cards.example_en: Financial education helps with budgeting.
They’re going to build a new house.
She built a successful business from scratch.
He’s working to build his confidence.
We need to build trust with the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To make or shape something physical.
back_cards.example_en: Kids love to build sandcastles at the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To anticipate or look forward to something.
back_cards.example_en: I expect the package to arrive tomorrow.
We expect rain this afternoon.
The boss expects us to finish early.
I didn’t expect her to win the race.

back_cards.definition_en: To drop or come down freely.
back_cards.example_en: The leaves fall every autumn.

Gas prices tend to fall in winter.

back_cards.definition_en: To happen or occur, as a season.
back_cards.example_en: School starts in the fall.
The old bridge might fall if not repaired.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a male person as the subject.
back_cards.example_en: He fixed the car himself.

back_cards.definition_en: Used for emphasis on a male.
back_cards.example_en: The president himself gave the speech.
He lives by himself in the cabin.

back_cards.definition_en: A reflexive action by a male.
back_cards.example_en: He hurt himself while playing soccer.
He’s not himself when he’s stressed.

back_cards.definition_en: The length of time someone has lived.
back_cards.example_en: She’s only 25, but wise for her age.
Retirement is common in old age.
The castle is from the medieval age.
This wine improves with age.

back_cards.definition_en: A group defined by years lived.
back_cards.example_en: This game is suitable for all ages.

back_cards.definition_en: Requiring a lot of effort or energy.
back_cards.example_en: This puzzle is really hard to solve.

back_cards.definition_en: Firm or solid to the touch.
back_cards.example_en: The ground is hard after the frost.
It’s hard to choose between the two options.
We had a hard winter last year.
She’s working hard to meet the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: A faculty like sight or hearing.
back_cards.example_en: Her sense of smell is very sharp.
I have a sense something’s wrong.
That decision makes no sense to me.
He has a good sense of humor.
In one sense, you’re right about that.

back_cards.definition_en: From one side to the other.
back_cards.example_en: We walked across the bridge.
The news spread across the city.
I came across an old friend yesterday.
Her fame is known across the country.
The store is just across the street.
I woke up early to catch the sunrise.

back_cards.definition_en: In the beginning of a period.
back_cards.example_en: The early 2000s had great music.
We got an early start on the project.
She arrived in the early afternoon.
The flowers bloomed early this spring.
I’m applying to college next year.
She went to a community college first.

back_cards.definition_en: A body of students or faculty.
back_cards.example_en: The college voted for a new president.
College life was exciting for him.
The college of engineering is highly ranked.

back_cards.definition_en: Sounds arranged to be pleasing or expressive.
back_cards.example_en: I listen to music to relax.

back_cards.definition_en: The art or study of musical composition.
back_cards.example_en: She’s majoring in music at college.

back_cards.definition_en: A genre or type of sound.
back_cards.example_en: I prefer country music over pop.
The music at the festival was amazing.
He’s learning to read music for piano.
A rainbow appeared after the rain.

back_cards.definition_en: To seem or look a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: She appears confident in her speech.
He didn’t appear at the meeting.
Her article appeared in the magazine.
The band will appear on TV tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: The faculty of thought and consciousness.
back_cards.example_en: Her mind is sharp for her age.

back_cards.definition_en: To care about or object to.
back_cards.example_en: Do you mind if I open the window?
Speak your mind during the discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: To pay attention to or heed.
back_cards.example_en: Mind the step, it’s a bit steep.
I can’t keep all these dates in mind.
The school district is hiring new teachers.

back_cards.definition_en: A geographic area with specific boundaries.
back_cards.example_en: We live in the downtown district.

back_cards.definition_en: An administrative division of a city.
back_cards.example_en: The historic district has old buildings.

back_cards.definition_en: A region with a specific purpose.
back_cards.example_en: This is the business district of the city.
She’s running for office in our district.
Can you grab me a cup of coffee?

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of measurement in cooking.
back_cards.example_en: The recipe calls for one cup of flour.

back_cards.definition_en: A trophy or prize in sports.
back_cards.example_en: They won the cup in the soccer tournament.
She filled a cup with candy for the kids.

back_cards.definition_en: A portion or serving of a drink.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s share a cup of tea this afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the body, not the mind.
back_cards.example_en: Physical exercise keeps you healthy.
The store sells physical books, not e-books.
Football is a very physical sport.
She got a physical checkup at the doctor.
The physical world fascinates scientists.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of increasing in size.
back_cards.example_en: The plant’s growth was fast this spring.
The company saw growth in sales.
Traveling led to her personal growth.
Population growth is a challenge here.
The doctor checked the growth on his skin.
Prices rise every year around the holidays.
She rose from her chair to greet us.
The sun rises early this time of year.

back_cards.definition_en: To grow in importance or status.
back_cards.example_en: He rose to the rank of manager quickly.
The people rose against the new law.
Hi, how’s it going?
Hi, can you help me with this?

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly way to say hello.
back_cards.example_en: She waved and said hi to her neighbor.
Hi, I’m new to the team.
He texted a quick hi to his friend.

back_cards.definition_en: A level of quality or expectation.
back_cards.example_en: This product meets safety standards.
The company has strict dress standards.
This is the standard model of the car.
Her work sets the standard for the team.
The standard of the regiment was raised.
I’m a huge fan of their music.
Turn on the fan; it’s hot in here.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who admires a person or thing.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a fan of classic movies.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool to create a breeze.
back_cards.example_en: He cooled himself with a handheld fan.

back_cards.definition_en: A devoted follower of a sport.
back_cards.example_en: The fans cheered loudly at the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A proposed explanation based on evidence.
back_cards.example_en: Her theory about the case was convincing.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of principles or ideas.
back_cards.example_en: We studied economic theory in class.
Einstein’s theory changed physics forever.
In theory, this plan should work.
The theory of evolution explains diversity.
The store staff was very helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of workers in a place.
back_cards.example_en: The hospital staff works long hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A stick or pole used for support.
back_cards.example_en: He leaned on his staff while hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of lines for musical notation.
back_cards.example_en: The notes were written on the staff.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause physical pain or injury.
back_cards.example_en: I hurt my ankle while running.
His words really hurt her feelings.
The storm hurt the crops badly.
My head hurts from all the noise.
The scandal hurt his reputation.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the law or permitted by it.
back_cards.example_en: Is it legal to park here?
She hired a legal team for the case.
They signed a legal contract yesterday.
The legal process can take months.
This is a legal copy of the software.

back_cards.definition_en: The ninth month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: School starts in September.
September brings cooler weather.
I’m starting my job in September.
The festival happens every September.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for academic or work cycles.
back_cards.example_en: We review budgets in September.

back_cards.definition_en: The area beyond a building or space.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s eat outside on the patio.

back_cards.definition_en: Not part of a group or system.
back_cards.example_en: They hired an outside consultant.

back_cards.definition_en: In the open air or outdoors.
back_cards.example_en: The kids are playing outside.
The outside of the house needs painting.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to cite a source or reference.
back_cards.example_en: The study by Smith et al. was groundbreaking.

back_cards.definition_en: Short for ‘and others’ in academic writing.
back_cards.example_en: Johnson et al. published a new paper.

The book by Brown et al. is on sale.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan to achieve a goal.
back_cards.example_en: Our strategy is to launch in spring.

back_cards.definition_en: A method for winning or succeeding.
back_cards.example_en: Her chess strategy was brilliant.
The company’s strategy focuses on growth.
